title: "No item found" diagnostic should suggest items that differ by case

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: An issue proposing an enhancement or a PR with one.

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: D-newcomer-roadblock
labels.description: Confusing diagnostic error hard to understand for new users

body:
Given the following code: https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=a494a5e7386a6c9e55f7f39695dece41

```rust
enum Foo {
    Bar(u32)
}

fn main() {
    matches!(todo!(), Foo::BAR(_));
}
```

The current output is:

```
error[E0599]: no variant or associated item named `BAR` found for enum `Foo` in the current scope
 --> src/main.rs:6:28
  |
1 | enum Foo {
  | -------- variant or associated item `BAR` not found here
...
6 |     matches!(todo!(), Foo::BAR(_));
  |                            ^^^ variant or associated item not found in `Foo`

```

<!-- The following is not always necessary. -->
Ideally the output should include a note suggesting the variant with the same name (but different case):

```
error[E0599]: no variant or associated item named `BAR` found for enum `Foo` in the current scope
 --> src/main.rs:6:28
  |
1 | enum Foo {
  | -------- variant or associated item `BAR` not found here
...
6 |     matches!(todo!(), Foo::BAR(_));
  |                            ^^^ variant or associated item not found in `Foo`
  | help: a similarly named variant exists: `Bar`
```
